summary: The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions on Liberia, Sierra Leone, and West Africa, affirms its commitment to Liberia's sovereignty and territorial integrity. It expresses appreciation to Nigeria for hosting former President Charles Taylor, who remains under indictment by the Special Court for Sierra Leone. The Council, acting under Chapter VII, decides to expand the mandate of the UN Mission in Liberia (UNMIL) to include apprehending and detaining Taylor if he returns to Liberia, and transferring him to Sierra Leone for prosecution. The Council will remain seized of the matter.
